title: Beyond Meat stock soars on McDonald's deal
text:
New York (CNN Business) Two all plant-based patties, special sauce, lettuce, cheese, pickles, onions on a sesame seed bun? Not yet. But McDonald's is partnering with Beyond Meat on a plant-based burger in Canada. And Beyond Meat investors love the news.

Beyond Meat's stock, trading around $150, is now up about 500% from its initial public offering price of $25. The company debuted on Wall Street in May and has been one of the year's splashiest IPOs.

Uber UBER Lyft LYFT Slack WORK Shares have fallen more than 30% from their all-time high though as investors have recently grown more skeptical about unprofitable startups likeand WeWork, which is shelving plans for an IPO until later this year.

There has been a lot of chatter in the restaurant world and on Wall Street about whether or not McDonald's has plans to one day launch a plant-based Big Mac, Quarter Pounder or other burger in the United States in light of Burger King's Impossible Whopper success.
